intro: Secamone dolichorhachys, commonly known as the long-stalked secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white to pale yellow petals, often accompanied by prominent stamens. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, elliptical seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
